entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

@myworcester @DaveThroupEA @WorcsTravel @davidblakeworc @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @WMerciaPolice @WorcesterTIC @WorcesterBID @ParentsVoiceWor @VisitWorcester A great job every time and very much appreciated - I love running round the river. Just need Sabrina Bridge to reopen now üëç

Don't get me wrong.

Thank you @ab4scambs for doing all this to save our #chalkstreamsincrisis, thank you üôè

But regulation needs to be enforced. Licenses need to be revoked. @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency have teeth. They need to start using them.

6/6

urls.title: 2020 ‚Äì 2021 Winter Season
urls.description: We are nearly half way through our winter break already. How time flies! With Christmas and New Year behind us we continue to keep ourselves apart from others and have been able to fit in a few morning walks on some of the bright chilly days. We usually get quite nice weather over in Lincolnshire at this time of the year and always enjoy the sunshine. We have also had rain and very cold days, like most of the country, but have been lucky with very little snow to speak of. Shrubs and trees in the Garden

tweets.text: Hope everyone is keeping safe and well.  Please find this months blog https://t.co/RvwW0meacJ @CRTBoating @CRTSouthEast @EnvAgency @VisitEngland#grandunioncanal #riverthames #winter #countryside #ukholidays #covid #familyholidays#goodtogo https://t.co/l6pxsZ3Ox7

Once again I am watching the Viking Recorder, @EnvAgencyYNE and currently it is saying that the Ouse will  rise to 3m tomorrow. The ground saturated. This is why I am meeting with the Minister next month again to highlight the need for upstream management.

@RussellB1ggs @N_Rivers_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @GlavenEel @_BrambleCottage @NFUtweets @DefraGovUK Not enough to just have in the header file, the photo itself MUST have time and date on it. Apart from anything else it acts a visual reminder

@Happy_Mapper @N_Rivers_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @GlavenEel @_BrambleCottage @NFUtweets @DefraGovUK The phone gives time/date and location. Did you see the film from @_BrambleCottage Snow on the ground so at least the EA can‚Äôt suggest that it was filmed in summer üòâ

@RussellB1ggs @N_Rivers_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @GlavenEel @_BrambleCottage @NFUtweets @DefraGovUK Also @The_WMA this HAS to surely have an impact on your sediment management of the Babingley? (I know the Cong is not your responsibility)
